website_summaries.verdict: The Loft adds a sizable battery to your Google Home without taking away any smarts or sound quality. If you want your smart speaker to be portable, it's a good option.
pros: The Ninety7 Loft easily snaps onto the Google Home and gave it a solid 10 hours of battery life in our tests -- a number that even exceeds the company's claims
cons: The battery life indicator isn't accurate

customer_reviews.title: This battery base makes the already awesome Google Home to something even more awesome
customer_reviews.text: This battery base makes the already awesome Google Home to something even more awesome. I wouldn't be surprised if future Google Homes come with a built-in battery base like this. It seems like a no-brainer. Instead of having to but Google Homes or Google Minis to every single room in my house, its great to just pick it up and take it to the room I am going to. I use it every morning, moving it to the bathroom so i can have music or listen to the new while im showering/shaving. And then bring it back to my bedroom as i get dressed.
customer_reviews.author: GadgetFreek

customer_reviews.title: Best. Thing. Ever. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: I've never written a review on here and I pulled this up just to do so. This product is AWESOME! BRILLIANT IDEA. Looks great, easy to set up. We're talking 10 seconds to switch this base on to your Google home. I got it a couple days ago and have taken upstairs, in the garage, back upstairs. When you're playing music and unplug it there is zero interference or skipping heard. It's seamless. I think the speaker sounds even better than it did with the original fabric cover the home came with. Bravo to this company. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Google Home Portability
customer_reviews.text: Great to have portability with my Google Home as long as I'm within range of my Wi-Fi router. The LED charge lights can be annoying when placed in a dark room. I solved this issue by simply turning the device towards the wall with no degradation of sound quality. The only complaint I have is the tight access for removing the OE power connector from the battery base. Care must be taken to gently wiggle the connector and ease it out rather than trying to pull it out directly.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Millet

customer_reviews.title: Works As Described With A Couple “Flaws”
customer_reviews.text: Solid product which looks nice like coupled with the Google Home. I haven’t used the battery extensively, however after a few hours of use only 1 of the 4 batter lights are dimmed. Speaking of the lights they do remain on at all times and are fairly bright which is a bit disappointing there is no option to dim once fully charged. As some others have mentioned the top of the case does does not line up perfectly with the bottom of the Google Home allowing a slight gap where the two meet. For this reason alone I’m taking off 1 Star.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!  Not designed for fat fingers
customer_reviews.text: Adds portability while maintaining the Google Home's overall design. Battery life is great! I've had it running on battery power for a whole 8 hour work shift at medium volume and it was still at 2 bars before i plugged it back in. By the next day, the unit back back to fully charged. One think I don't like is that my fat fingers have a difficult time unplugging the OEM charging cable from the battery base. I feel as if I will eventually damage the cable over time because disconnecting the cable from the base sometimes bends the cable end into a not normal position, because my fat fingers dont have enough room to grab ahold of it completely.
customer_reviews.author: Chu

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
